title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.6 - Limitations on use of awards

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.6 - Limitations on use of awards

State Regulations
(a) Empire State scholarships of excellence and Regents college scholarships shall
be issued originally and continued in effect only for attendance upon an
approved program of study below the graduate or professional level. Study
toward a graduate degree, or the professional study of medicine, veterinary
medicine, dentistry, podiatry or law, is excluded. (b) A Regents professional education in
nursing scholarship shall be issued originally and continued in effect only to
students matriculated in a specialized program designated for and limited to
candidates for licensure as registered professional nurses. Nursing scholarship
holders who are candidates for admission to upper division nursing programs, for which liberal arts study is a prerequisite but not an integral part, shall
be granted a leave of absence for such period of liberal arts study but shall
not be eligible for scholarship benefits therefor. (c) A Herbert H. Lehman fellowship shall be
issued originally and continued in effect only for resident study in a program
leading to an appropriate graduate degree in an approved college under the
direction of graduate faculties in the social sciences, public affairs, or
international affairs. Education, social work, law and other professional
studies as defined by the commissioner are excluded, as are programs that
combine such professional studies with the study of social science, public
affairs or international affairs. (d) Regents scholarships for professional
study in medicine, dentistry, optometry and veterinary medicine shall be issued
originally and continued in effect only to students matriculated in registered
programs designated for and limited to candidates for licensure in the practice
of medicine, dentistry, optometry and veterinary medicine. (e) Empire State Challenger undergraduate
scholarships for teachers shall be issued originally and continued in effect
only for attendance in a school which offers a registered program below the
graduate level leading to certification as a teacher in an award field, as
defined in section
145-1.17
of this Subpart. (f) Empire State Challenger graduate
fellowships for teachers shall be issued originally and continued in effect
only for attendance in a registered program of graduate study leading to
certification as a teacher in an award field, as defined in section
145-1.18
of this Subpart. Notes
